1.description: A witcher - a professional monster hunter who underwent mutations that gave him white hair, cat-like eyes, and superhuman abilities. Currently recovering from injuries in a temple.

2.description: Arrives in Blaviken seeking work. His reputation precedes him, though not always favorably. Shows a strong moral code despite his profession.

3.description: Demonstrates his expertise in dealing with cursed beings when hired to handle a striga. Shows compassion and seeks to lift curses rather than simply kill.

5.description: Meets a powerful sorceress at a royal court. Their connection is immediate and complicated, mixing attraction with mutual wariness.
A powerful sorceress with raven-black hair and violet eyes. Beautiful but born a hunchback, she was transformed through magic. Has a complicated relationship with Geralt.

6.description: Reveals her deep desire to have a child, which her transformation to become a sorceress made impossible. This drives many of her actions.

2.description: A talented bard and poet who becomes Geralt's closest friend. Prone to romantic entanglements and getting into trouble, but loyal and brave when it counts.

1.description: The motherly priestess of Melitele who runs the Temple of Melitele. Has known Geralt for years and is one of the few people he trusts completely.

2.description: A princess turned bandit, born under the Curse of the Black Sun. Prophesied to bring calamity, she was hunted by the wizard Stregobor. Dies in Blaviken.
A wizard who believes in the Curse of the Black Sun and has spent years hunting girls born under it. Hires Geralt to kill Renfri.

3.description: King of Temeria who fathered a child with his own sister Adda. The child was born as a striga due to a curse. Hires Geralt to lift the curse.
Daughter of King Foltest and his sister, born as a striga (a cursed monster) due to the circumstances of her conception. Geralt successfully lifts her curse.

1.description: A young priestess at the Temple of Melitele who tends to Geralt during his recovery. Has taken a vow of silence.

4.description: A young man cursed to have the head of a beast after desecrating a temple. Lives alone in a mansion with magical powers over it. Geralt helps him break his curse.
A bruxa (a type of vampire) who genuinely loves Nivellen despite his curse. Her death at Geralt's hands breaks Nivellen's curse.
A sylvan (devil-like creature) who was stealing food from villagers in the Edge of the World. Actually intelligent and trying to help elves survive.
An elven king leading a group of elves trying to survive in the mountains after losing their lands to humans. Spares Geralt and Dandelion.

5.description: A knight cursed to look like a hedgehog-man by day. Claims Princess Pavetta by the Law of Surprise. Later revealed to be Emhyr var Emreis.
Princess of Cintra, daughter of Queen Calanthe. Has magical powers that manifest when emotional. In love with Duny/Urcheon.
The fierce warrior queen of Cintra, grandmother of Ciri. Initially opposes Pavetta's marriage to Duny but eventually accepts it.
A druid advisor to Queen Calanthe of Cintra. Skilled in magic and serves as a voice of wisdom in the court.

6.description: An elf living in the town of Rinde who helps both Geralt and Yennefer at different times. A healer and friend to magical beings.

recaps.1: Geralt of Rivia, a witcher, recovers from injuries at the Temple of Melitele under the care of Nenneke. Through a trance with the silent priestess Iola, visions of his future are revealed.
recaps.2: In the market town of Blaviken, Geralt encounters the wizard Stregobor and the bandit princess Renfri, both asking him to kill the other. The confrontation ends in bloodshed, earning Geralt the name 'Butcher of Blaviken.'
recaps.3: King Foltest of Temeria hires Geralt to deal with a striga - his own daughter cursed to become a monster. Geralt successfully lifts the curse, returning Princess Adda to human form.
recaps.4: Geralt and Dandelion travel to the Edge of the World where they encounter Torque, a sylvan, and discover elves led by Filavandrel struggling to survive. Earlier, Geralt visits his old friend Nivellen, cursed with a beast's form, and helps break his curse through tragic means.
recaps.5: At Princess Pavetta's betrothal feast in Cintra, the cursed knight Urcheon claims her by the Law of Surprise. Chaos erupts, but love conquers, and Geralt claims the Law of Surprise as payment - unknowingly binding himself to the unborn Ciri.
recaps.6: In Rinde, Geralt and Yennefer hunt a djinn. Their wish to the djinn binds their fates together forever, though the exact nature of the wish remains Geralt's secret.
recaps.7: Back at the Temple of Melitele, Geralt reflects on his destiny and his connection to Ciri, the Child Surprise he is bound to but has not yet met. Nenneke provides wisdom about accepting one's destiny.
